title: How to Clean Vomit from Wood Floors

steps.title: Protect yourself.
steps.content: Protect yourself. If the sick person has any kind of virus, you don't want to expose yourself to it. Put on some disposable gloves. If necessary, use extra protection, like a hygienic mask.

steps.title: Wipe up any large chunks immediately.
steps.content: Wipe up any large chunks immediately. Vomit often has large chunks of food in it. These should be wiped up immediately using paper towels. Transfer as many large chunks as you can to a garbage bag right away.

steps.title: Scrub the spot with an enzyme cleaner and water.
steps.content: Scrub the spot with an enzyme cleaner and water. Vomit is often acidic and requires a enzyme-containing cleaner. You should be able to find enzyme cleaners online or at department stores. Spritz some of the cleaner on the vomit. Then, use a damp rag or paper towel to gently scrub the vomit off the floor. If you don't have an enzyme cleaner on hand, you can use dish soap. While it's generally best to use a stronger cleaner, dish soap in your kitchen can work in a pinch.

steps.title: Soak up any lingering vomit.
steps.content: Soak up any lingering vomit. If there's any bits of vomit remaining on the floor, soak them up. Liquid residue may linger after cleaning, for example. Press a paper towel or clean rag over the spot to remove any lingering traces of vomit.

steps.title: Add baking soda.
steps.content: Add baking soda. Baking soda naturally eliminates a wide variety of smells. If the scent of vomit lingers after you clean it, mix baking soda and water until you form a thick paste. Then, spread the paste over the area that smells. Cover the baking soda with paper towel and let it sit overnight. In the morning, remove the paper towel and vacuum up the remaining baking soda.

steps.title: Use strong scented soaps.
steps.content: Use strong scented soaps. Soaps with strong smells and odor-eliminating agents can easily remove the smell of vomit from your floor. Try applying some of the following to the area in the event the smell lingers: Soaps designed to remove pet odor Soaps with strong scents A blend of strong-smelling shampoo and conditioner

steps.title: Try vinegar and water.
steps.content: Try vinegar and water. Mix one part distilled vinegar with two parts water. Then, add a few drops of a citrus-scented dish soap. Clean the area with the vinegar/water mixture and see if you notice a reduced odor.

steps.title: Spritz on some window cleaner.
steps.content: Spritz on some window cleaner. Window cleaner has a strong smell and may mask bad odors. Dilute the window cleaner with a little water first, however, as the strong chemicals may harm a wood floor. Wipe down the area with the diluted window cleaner and see if you notice a fresher smell.

steps.title: Test any cleaners you use first.
steps.content: Test any cleaners you use first. Before using a cleaner, apply it to a small, unnoticeable patch of your floor. Let it sit on for a few hours to make sure it does not harm your floor.

steps.title: Contact a professional in the event of a set in stain.
steps.content: Contact a professional in the event of a set in stain. Vomit can cause stains in wood. These are best addressed by professionals. You can easily harm wood floor by attempting to clean it yourself, so contact a professional cleaner to address stains. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Be gentle when scrubbing.
steps.content: Be gentle when scrubbing. Wood floor can scratch easily. Use a non-abrasive rag when cleaning and scrub out the vomit slowly and gently. This reduces the likelihood of scratch marks.
